Topic: Geography
Question: What is the capital of the state where Johns Hopkins University is located?
Choices:
  A: Baltimore
  B: Annapolis
  C: Des Moines
  D: Las Vegas

Thought: 
Johns Hopkins University is located in Baltimore, Maryland.
The capital of Maryland is Annapolis.
Action: Answer("B")

Topic: Law
Context: A bakery makes exactly three kinds of cookieâ€”oatmeal, peanut butter, and sugar. Exactly three batches of each kind of cookie are made each week (Monday through Friday) and each batch is made, from start to finish, on a single day. The following conditions apply: No two batches of the same kind of cookie are made on the same day. At least one batch of cookies is made on Monday. The second batch of oatmeal cookies is made on the same day as the first batch of peanut butter cookies. The second batch of sugar cookies is made on Thursday.
Question: If no batch of cookies is made on Wednesday, then which one of the following must be true?
Choices:
  A: Exactly three batches of cookies are made on Tuesday.
  B: Exactly three batches of cookies are made on Friday.
  C: At least two batches of cookies are made on Monday.
  D: At least two batches of cookies are made on Thursday.
  E: Fewer batches of cookies are made on Monday than on Tuesday.
Reflection:
You previously answered this question incorrectly.
Then you reflected on the problem, your solution, and the correct answer.
Use your self-reflection (below) to help you answer this question.
Any information that you are not allowed to see will be marked [REDACTED].
Error Keywords:

Thought:
Since no batch of cookies is made on Wednesday, the nine batches must be distributed among the other four days.
Monday cannot have more than three batches since at most one batch of each kind of cookie can be made on a single day.
Since at least one batch is made on Monday, and the second batch of oatmeal cookies is made on the same day as the first batch of peanut butter cookies, Monday must have at least two batches.
If Monday had three batches, then Thursday would have only one batch (the second batch of sugar cookies), which contradicts the condition that no two batches of the same kind of cookie are made on the same day.
Therefore, Monday must have exactly two batches, and Thursday must have exactly two batches as well (the second batch of sugar cookies and one more batch).
This leaves three batches to be made on Tuesday and two batches to be made on Friday.
Action: Answer("A")

Self-reflection:
I initially misinterpreted the condition that no two batches of the same kind of cookie are made on the same day as meaning that no two batches of any kind of cookie can be made on the same day.
I also overlooked the condition that at least one batch of cookies is made on Monday.
After carefully rereading the problem and considering the conditions, I realized that Monday must have exactly two batches and Thursday must have exactly two batches as well.
This leaves three batches to be made on Tuesday and two batches to be made on Friday.
Therefore, the correct answer is "Exactly three batches of cookies are made on Tuesday."
